    • Method Detail

      • getGecis

        public static java.lang.String[] getGecis​(java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement element)
        Get the strings of the values of the Geci annotations that are on the element parameter. The Geci annotation has a single value parameter that is a string.

        The method takes care of the special case when there is only one Geci annotation on the element and also when there are many.

        Parameters:
        element - the class, method or field that is annotated.
        Returns:
        the array of string that contains the values of the annotations. If the element is not annotated then the returned array will have zero elements. If there is one }Geci annotation then the returned String array will have one element. If there are many annotations then the array will contains each of the values.

      • getParameters

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getParameters​(java.lang.String s)
        Get the parameters into a map from the string. The Geci annotation has one single value that is a string. This string is supposed to have the format: 
        
     generator_menomic key='value' ... key='value'

        The key can be anything that is more or less an identifier (contains only alphanumeric characters, underscore and $ charater, but can also start with any of those, thus it could be '1966').

        The value is enclosed between single quotes, that makes it easier to type and read as single quotes do not need escaping in strings. These quotes can not be skipped.

        Parameters:
        s - the string parameter
        Returns:
        the map composed from the string

      • getParameters

        public static CompoundParams getParameters​(java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement element,
                                           java.lang.String generatorMnemonic)
        Get the parameters from the element from the Geci annotation that stands for the generator that has the mnemonic generatorMnemonic.
        Parameters:
        element - the method, class etc. that has the }Geci annotation.
        generatorMnemonic - the parameters parsed into a CompoundParams object.
        Returns:
        the new CompoundParams object or null in case there is no annotation matching the generator mnemonic.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the string containing the modifiers space separated

      • normalizeTypeName

        public static java.lang.String normalizeTypeName​(java.lang.String s)
        Normalize a generic type name removing all java.lang. from the type names.

        Even the generated code should be human readable, especially when you debug the working of the code. In that case the generic names with all the java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer and so on are disturbing. This method removes those prefixes.

        Note that the prefixes java.util. and similar others that are usually imported by the class are NOT removed.

        Parameters:
        s - generic type name to be normalized
        Returns:
        the normalized type name

      • getGenericTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getGenericTypeName​(java.lang.reflect.Type t)
        Get the generic type name of the type passed as argument. The JDK Type#getTypeName() returns a string that contains the classes with their names and not with the canonical names (inner classes have $ in the names instead of dot). This method goes through the type structure and converts the names (generic types also) to
        Parameters:
        t - the type
        Returns:
        the type as string

      • getDeclaredFieldsSorted

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field[] getDeclaredFieldsSorted​(java.lang.Class<?> klass)
        Get the declared fields of the class sorted alphabetically. The actual order is usually not interesting for the code generators, but a deterministic order is. When a code generator generates code for all or for some of the declared fields it is important that the order is always the same. If the order changes from time to time then it may happen that the code generation creates the code every time differently and breaking the build. It happens in practice, for example, when you have a different version of Java on the development machine and on the build server. In development you run the build, generate the code, run the build again, commit the code. You expect that on the build server the code generation will not fail because all the generated code is there in the repository in the files. However, you may use a different version of Java (even if only different build) on the build server and because of that the order of the fields is different and the generated code is different, although functionally it is the same.

        This method and also the getDeclaredMethodsSorted(Class) can and should be used by code generators to have a deterministic output.

        Parameters:
        klass - of which the fields are collected
        Returns:
        the sorted array of fields

      • getDeclaredMethodsSorted

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] getDeclaredMethodsSorted​(java.lang.Class<?> klass)
        Get the declared methods of the class sorted.

        See the notes at the javadoc of the method getDeclaredFieldsSorted(Class)

        The methods are sorted according to the string representation of the signature. How the method signature is created is document in the javadoc of the method MethodTool.methodSignature(Method)

        Parameters:
        klass - class of which the methods are returned
        Returns:
        the sorted array of the methods

      • separator

        public static Tools.Separator separator​(java.lang.String sep)

      • mask

        public static int mask​(java.lang.String masks,
                       int dfault)
        Convert a string that contains lower case letter Java modifiers comma separated into an access mask.
        Parameters:
        masks - is the comma separated list of modifiers. The list can also contain the word package that will be translated to PACKAGE since there is no modifier package in Java.
        dfault - the mask to return in case the includes string is empty.
        Returns:
        the mask converted from String

      • isGenerated

        public static boolean isGenerated​(java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement element)
        Checks if the element is real source code or was generated.

        Generators are encouraged to annotate the generated elements with the annotation Generated. This is good for the human reader and the same time some generators can decide if an element is in the compiled class because it was generated or because the programmer provided a version for the element manually. For example the delegator generator does not generate the delegating methods that are provided by the programmer manually but it regenerates all methods that are needed and have the Generated annotation.

        Parameters:
        element - that needs the decision if it is generated or manually programmed
        Returns:
        true if the element was generated (has the annotation Generated).
